briefdescription.para: Stops any filtering. All messages are sent.
Sends the first event. All remaining messages are filtered.
Sends the first 2 events. All remaining messages are filtered.
Sends the first 4 events. All remaining messages are filtered.
Sends the first 8 events. All remaining messages are filtered.
Sends the first 16 events. All remaining messages are filtered.
Sends the first 32 events. All remaining messages are filtered.
Sends the first 64 events. All remaining messages are filtered.
Sends every other event.
Sends two, filters one, sends two, filters one, etc.
Sends every fourth event message. All others are filtered.
Events that are intended only for debugging, not nominal operations.
Events that identify a state change or action that is not an error.
Events that identify an error but are not catastrophic (e.g. - bad command.
Events that identify errors that are unrecoverable autonomously.
Register an application for receiving event services.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to an array of event message filters, or NULL if no filtering is desired. The structure of an event message filter depends on the FilterScheme selected. (see Filter Schemes mentioned above)
The number of event message filters included in this call. This must be less than or equal to the maximum number of events allowed per application (#CFE_EVS_MAX_EVENT_FILTERS).
The event filtering scheme that this application will use. For the first implementation of the event services, only filter type CFE_EVS_BINARY_FILTER will be supported.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Number of Application event filters input upon registration is greater than #CFE_EVS_MAX_EVENT_FILTERS
CFE_EVS_Register() FilterScheme parameter was illegal
Application ID returned by CFE_ES_GetAppIDByName is greater than #CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS
Any of the error codes from CFE_ES_GetAppID

briefdescription.para: Cleanup internal structures used by the event manager for the calling Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine un-registers the calling application from receiving event services and removes and deletes the calling applications filters and counters from the internal event service filter and counter tables if registered. Applications must call this routine as part of their orderly shutdown process.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Calling application never previously called CFE_EVS_Register()
Application ID returned by CFE_ES_GetAppIDByName is greater than #CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS
Any of the error codes from CFE_ES_GetAppID
Any of the error codes from CFE_ES_PutPoolBuf

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16 EventID, uint16 EventType, const char *Spec,...) OS_PRINTF(3
memberdef.name: CFE_EVS_SendEvent

briefdescription.para: Generate a software event.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine generates a software event message. If the EventID is not filtered, the event will be sent as a software bus message, optionally logged in the local event log, and optionally sent as an ASCII text string out the enabled output port(s).

parameterdescription.para: A numeric literal used to uniquely identify an application event. The EventID is defined and supplied by the application sending the event.

A numeric literal used to classify an event, one of:
CFE_EVS_DEBUG
CFE_EVS_INFORMATION
CFE_EVS_ERROR
CFE_EVS_CRITICAL

A pointer to a null terminated text string describing the output format for the event. This is the same type of format string used for the ANSI printf function. Nominally the post-conversion string is limited to 80 characters, but this limit is configurable through the parameter CFE_EVS_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH. Characters beyond the limit will be truncated. Do not use floating point conversions (f, e, E, g, and G) in the format string unless your application will be running in a system that supports floating point arithmetic. Do not use non-printable characters (\t, \n, etc.) in the format string; they will mess up the formatting when the events are displayed on the ground system.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Calling application never previously called CFE_EVS_Register()
Application ID returned by CFE_ES_GetAppIDByName is greater than #CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS
Any of the error codes from CFE_ES_GetAppID
Any of the error codes from CFE_SB_SendMsg

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16 EventID, uint16 EventType, uint32 AppID, const char *Spec,...) OS_PRINTF(4
memberdef.name: CFE_EVS_SendEventWithAppID

briefdescription.para: Generate a software event given the specified Application ID.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine generates a software event message. If the EventID is not filtered, the event will be sent as a software bus message, optionally logged in the local event log, and optionally sent as an ASCII text string out the enabled output port(s). Note that this function should really only be used from within an API in order to preserve the context of an Application's event. In general, CFE_EVS_SendEvent should be used.

parameterdescription.para: A numeric literal used to uniquely identify an application event. The EventID is defined and supplied by the application sending the event.

A numeric literal used to classify an event, one of:
CFE_EVS_DEBUG
CFE_EVS_INFORMATION
CFE_EVS_ERROR
CFE_EVS_CRITICAL
The Application ID from which the event message should appear.

A pointer to a null terminated text string describing the output format for the event. This is the same type of format string used for the ANSI printf function. Nominally the post-conversion string is limited to 80 characters, but this limit is configurable through the parameter CFE_EVS_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH. Characters beyond the limit will be truncated. Do not use floating point conversions (f, e, E, g, and G) in the format string unless your application will be running in a system that supports floating point arithmetic. Do not use non-printable characters (\t, \n, etc.) in the format string; they will mess up the formatting when the events are displayed on the ground system.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Calling application never previously called CFE_EVS_Register()
Application ID returned by CFE_ES_GetAppIDByName is greater than #CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS
Any of the error codes from CFE_ES_GetAppID
Any of the error codes from CFE_SB_SendMsg

memberdef.argsstring: (CFE_TIME_SysTime_t Time, uint16 EventID, uint16 EventType, const char *Spec,...) OS_PRINTF(4
memberdef.name: CFE_EVS_SendTimedEvent

briefdescription.para: Generate a software event with a specific time tag.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine is the same as CFE_EVS_SendEvent except that the caller specifies the event time instead of having the EVS use the current spacecraft time. This routine should be used in situations where an error condition is detected at one time, but the event message is reported at a later time.

parameterdescription.para: The time to include in the event. This will usually be a time returned by the function CFE_TIME_GetTime().
A numeric literal used to uniquely identify an application event. The EventID is defined and supplied by the application sending the event.

A numeric literal used to classify an event, one of:
CFE_EVS_DEBUG
CFE_EVS_INFORMATION
CFE_EVS_ERROR
CFE_EVS_CRITICAL

A pointer to a null terminated text string describing the output format for the event. This is the same type of format string used for the ANSI printf function. Nominally the post-conversion string is limited to 80 characters, but this limit is configurable through the parameter CFE_EVS_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH. Characters beyond the limit will be truncated. Do not use floating point conversions (f, e, E, g, and G) in the format string unless your application will be running in a system that supports floating point arithmetic. Do not use non-printable characters (\t, \n, etc.) in the format string; they will mess up the formatting when the events are displayed on the ground system.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Calling application never previously called CFE_EVS_Register()
Application ID returned by CFE_ES_GetAppIDByName is greater than #CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS
Any of the error codes from CFE_ES_GetAppID
Any of the error codes from CFE_SB_SendMsg

briefdescription.para: Resets the calling application's event filter for a single event ID.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The effect of resetting an event filter depends on the filter scheme. The CFE_EVS_BINARY_FILTER scheme resets the filter counter for the specified Event ID.

parameterdescription.para: A numeric literal used to uniquely identify an application event. The EventID is defined and supplied by the application sending the event.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Calling application never previously called CFE_EVS_Register()
Application ID returned by CFE_ES_GetAppIDByName is greater than #CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS
Any of the error codes from CFE_ES_GetAppID

briefdescription.para: Resets all of the calling application's event filters.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine resets all the calling application's event filter counters to zero, providing a quick and convenient method for resetting event filters.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Calling application never previously called CFE_EVS_Register()
Application ID returned by CFE_ES_GetAppIDByName is greater than #CFE_ES_MAX_APPLICATIONS
Any of the error codes from CFE_ES_GetAppID
